wf_workflow_version.name: Study Abroad Approval
wf_workflow_version.on_cancel: // This script executes if the workflow is cancelled.// The global variable context_sys_id contains the sys_id of the cancelled workflow context.

wf_activity.name: Director of International Programs Approval Request

sys_variable_value.value: // Set the variable 'answer' to a comma-separated list of user or group sys_ids that you want the email sent to.
// Set the variable 'answer' to a comma-separated list of user or group sys_ids that you want the email sent to.

activity.display_value: Director of International Programs Approval Request

sys_variable_value.value: // Set the variable 'answer' to a comma-separated list of user or group sys_ids that you want the email sent to.
// Set the variable 'answer' to a comma-separated list of user or group sys_ids that you want the email sent to.

wf_activity.name: Student Notification - Program Director Contract Approved

sys_variable_value.value: // Set the variable 'answer' to a comma-separated list of user or group sys_ids that you want the email sent to.
// Set the variable 'answer' to a comma-separated list of user or group sys_ids that you want the email sent to.

activity.display_value: Student Notification - Program Director Contract Approved

sys_variable_value.value: Hello ${student_application.student_name}, Greetings from the Study Abroad Office and the Office of International Programs! We are happy to inform you that you have been accepted into the ${student_application.study_abroad_program} program for Spring 2019!!! We have received your first study abroad payment, which is why you are receiving this email. We will be using your Clayton State e-mail as a primary contact over the next several months to send you vital information about your program. Failure to respond or follow these e-mails could disrupt your program attendance.   Below is a list of items that you are required to complete as a participant of the ${student_application.study_abroad_program} program. The attached Student Program Guide details the requirements for each of the necessary items, the penalties for not meeting specified deadlines, along with other important program information. Students are advised to read this guide in its entirety within one week of acceptance and to contact your study abroad advisor Sasha Cokuslu (SashaCokuslu@clayton.edu) or the Program Director if you have any questions. You can also forward this email to your parent and/or guardian so they can help ensure you meet these deadlines to avoid late fees or penalties; though our office will not be able to communicate with your parent or guardian due to FERPA laws.   1st Payment received. Thank you for submitting your first payment!   Attend the *mandatory* student orientation with the Study Abroad Office on ${student_application.study_abroad_program.orientation_scheduled}.   Complete your Health Clearance Form due by or before ${student_application.study_abroad_program.health_clearance_due}.   2nd Payment due ${student_application.study_abroad_program.u_second_payment}.  Copy of your PASSPORT due by or before ${student_application.study_abroad_program.passport_deadline}.   3rd and Final Payment due ${student_application.study_abroad_program.u_third_payment}.   You can learn more about your study abroad program by visiting the Study Abroad website and the Study Abroad Program Guide. Social Media: Take a moment to LIKE the Study Abroad Programs at Clayton State University Facebook page. The page will keep you updated on events, deadlines, and upcoming opportunities related to international programs. Or you can also follow along with us on Instagram! Instagram | YouTube Travel insurance is not covered in your program costs and fees. Learn more about this insurance coverage by visiting our website here. We look forward to working with you this year! Please let our team know if you have any questions or concerns, we are here to assist. Best Regards, The Study Abroad Office Clayton State University StudyAbroad@clayton.edu 678-466-4092 / 678-466-4090
// Set the variable 'answer' to a comma-separated list of user or group sys_ids that you want the email sent to.

Hello ${student_application.student_name}, Greetings from the Study Abroad Office and the Office of International Programs! We are happy to inform you that you have been accepted into the ${student_application.study_abroad_program} program for Spring 2019!!! We have received your first study abroad payment, which is why you are receiving this email. We will be using your Clayton State e-mail as a primary contact over the next several months to send you vital information about your program. Failure to respond or follow these e-mails could disrupt your program attendance.   Below is a list of items that you are required to complete as a participant of the ${student_application.study_abroad_program} program. The attached Student Program Guide details the requirements for each of the necessary items, the penalties for not meeting specified deadlines, along with other important program information. Students are advised to read this guide in its entirety within one week of acceptance and to contact your study abroad advisor Sasha Cokuslu (SashaCokuslu@clayton.edu) or the Program Director if you have any questions. You can also forward this email to your parent and/or guardian so they can help ensure you meet these deadlines to avoid late fees or penalties; though our office will not be able to communicate with your parent or guardian due to FERPA laws.   1st Payment received. Thank you for submitting your first payment!   Attend the *mandatory* student orientation with the Study Abroad Office on ${student_application.study_abroad_program.orientation_scheduled}.   Complete your Health Clearance Form due by or before ${student_application.study_abroad_program.health_clearance_due}.   2nd Payment due ${student_application.study_abroad_program.u_second_payment}.  Copy of your PASSPORT due by or before ${student_application.study_abroad_program.passport_deadline}.   3rd and Final Payment due ${student_application.study_abroad_program.u_third_payment}.   You can learn more about your study abroad program by visiting the Study Abroad website and the Study Abroad Program Guide. Social Media: Take a moment to LIKE the Study Abroad Programs at Clayton State University Facebook page. The page will keep you updated on events, deadlines, and upcoming opportunities related to international programs. Or you can also follow along with us on Instagram! Instagram | YouTube Travel insurance is not covered in your program costs and fees. Learn more about this insurance coverage by visiting our website here. We look forward to working with you this year! Please let our team know if you have any questions or concerns, we are here to assist. Best Regards, The Study Abroad Office Clayton State University StudyAbroad@clayton.edu 678-466-4092 / 678-466-4090
